title: Community Layer Value Recognition for Person with Disabilities
description: As a person with disabilities engaging in community organizing and governance Operating at the community governance layer I want my disability advocacy and community-building recognized as essential care work So that disability justice strengthens the entire community's care economy
content:

Feature: Community Layer Value Recognition for Person with Disabilities
  As a person with disabilities engaging in community organizing and governance
  Operating at the community governance layer
  I want my disability advocacy and community-building recognized as essential care work
  So that disability justice strengthens the entire community's care economy

  Background:
    Given the Elohim Protocol is operational
    And the person_with_disabilities user "Alex" is registered in the system
    And Alex is an experienced disability advocate and organizer
    And Alex participates in local disability rights organizations
    And the community governance context is active
    And the community_elohim coordinates broader care economy
    And Alex has expertise in accessibility, disability justice, and community organizing

  Scenario: Alex's disability advocacy recognized as sophisticated care work
    Given Alex performs substantial disability rights organizing
    And advocacy improves systems for entire disabled community
    When the community_elohim tracks care contributions
    Then Alex's advocacy work should accumulate significant care tokens
    And organizing should be valued as skilled professional labor
    And systems change work should be recognized as high-impact care
    And Alex's contributions should create substantial care economy standing
    And the protocol should make visible that advocacy is care work
    And community should understand Alex is creating public goods
    And care tokens should reflect the scale of Alex's community impact

  Scenario: Building disability community infrastructure as care economy practice
    Given Alex works to connect disabled people to each other
    And peer networks are essential care economy infrastructure
    When Alex facilitates disability community connections
    Then the community_elohim should recognize network-building as care work
    And peer support groups Alex organizes should count as care contribution
    And accessible events Alex coordinates should accumulate tokens
    And disability culture-building should be valued appropriately
    And Alex's infrastructure work strengthens entire care economy
    And the protocol should see that disability community is care infrastructure
    And Alex's organizing makes mutual aid possible for others

  Scenario: Policy advocacy improves accessibility for entire community
    Given Alex advocates for accessibility improvements in public spaces
    And better accessibility benefits everyone, not just disabled people
    When community accessibility improves due to Alex's advocacy
    Then these improvements should be attributed to Alex's care work
    And the community_elohim should track policy changes Alex influences
    And curb cuts, accessible transit, universal design benefit whole community
    And Alex should be recognized as community improver at scale
    And care tokens should reflect population-level impact
    And the protocol should make undeniable Alex's gift to community
    And cultural narrative should shift from burden to contributor

  Scenario: Disability justice education transforms community culture
    Given Alex teaches community about disability justice frameworks
    And education shifts how community understands disability
    When Alex provides training, workshops, or consultation
    Then this educational labor should be valued as care work
    And the community_elohim should track Alex's teaching contributions
    And cultural transformation work should accumulate care tokens
    And Alex's expertise should be compensated appropriately
    And education that reduces ableism is high-value care work
    And the protocol should recognize teaching as care labor
    And Alex's intellectual contributions should be properly valued

  Scenario: Connecting disabled people to resources and support
    Given Alex has expertise about disability resources and systems
    And many disabled people struggle to navigate complex systems
    When Alex helps other disabled people access resources
    Then this navigation support should be recognized as care work
    And the community_elohim should track Alex's peer support
    And connecting people to resources should accumulate care tokens
    And Alex's expertise reduces others' suffering and struggle
    And peer navigation is sophisticated skilled labor
    And the protocol should value disability community mutual aid
    And Alex's support enables others' flourishing

  Scenario: Organizing collective action for systems change
    Given individual advocacy often fails against systemic ableism
    And collective power is necessary for disability justice
    When Alex organizes disabled people for collective action
    Then organizing labor should be recognized as care work
    And the community_elohim should track Alex's movement-building contributions
    And collective action that wins improvements should be valued highly
    And Alex's organizing strengthens disability community power
    And care tokens should reflect the sophistication of organizing work
    And the protocol should recognize that justice work is care work
    And Alex's leadership builds capacity for entire community

  Scenario: Community governance includes disabled people's voices
    Given community decisions often exclude disabled people
    And "Nothing about us without us" is disability rights principle
    When community governance decisions are made
    Then the community_elohim should ensure disabled people's participation
    And Alex should be included in relevant decision-making processes
    And accessibility should be standard for all governance activities
    And disabled people's expertise should shape community policy
    And the protocol should structurally include disabled voices
    And community should practice disability justice in governance
    And Alex's participation should be valued, not tokenized

  Scenario: Disability community mutual aid networks coordinate support
    Given disabled people practice mutual aid extensively
    And peer support networks are essential for survival and flourishing
    When the community_elohim tracks disability community care flows
    Then mutual aid within disability community should be highly valued
    And Alex's participation in peer networks should accumulate tokens
    And care should be recognized as flowing in multiple directions
    And disability mutual aid should be seen as care economy infrastructure
    And the protocol should honor interdependence as community practice
    And peer support should be valued as essential care work
    And disabled people's care for each other should be made visible

  Scenario: Accessibility consulting creates community economic opportunity
    Given Alex has deep expertise in accessibility and universal design
    And organizations need guidance to improve accessibility
    When Alex provides accessibility consulting
    Then this skilled professional work should be appropriately compensated
    And the community_elohim should facilitate connecting Alex to consulting opportunities
    And care tokens should reflect the value of Alex's expertise
    And accessibility work should be recognized as economic contribution
    And the protocol should support disabled people's economic participation
    And Alex's knowledge should create income opportunities
    And community should pay fairly for disability expertise

  Scenario: Crisis response for disability community during emergencies
    Given emergencies disproportionately harm disabled people
    And Alex coordinates disability community emergency response
    When community faces crisis (pandemic, disaster, etc.)
    Then Alex's crisis organizing should be recognized as essential care work
    And the community_elohim should support disability-led emergency response
    And Alex's work protecting vulnerable community members should be highly valued
    And care tokens should reflect the lifesaving nature of crisis work
    And the protocol should enable rapid mutual aid coordination
    And disability community expertise should guide emergency systems
    And Alex's leadership should be supported with resources

  Scenario: Cultural representation challenges ableist narratives
    Given media representation of disability is often harmful
    And Alex works to improve disability representation
    When Alex engages in cultural advocacy (media, arts, education)
    Then representation work should be recognized as care labor
    And the community_elohim should value cultural transformation efforts
    And challenging ableist narratives benefits entire disabled community
    And Alex's cultural work should accumulate care tokens
    And the protocol should recognize that culture shapes material conditions
    And representation advocacy is sophisticated intellectual labor
    And Alex's contributions shift what community believes about disability

  Scenario: Protecting disability community from institutional harm
    Given institutions often harm disabled people systematically
    And Alex advocates against institutional ableism
    When Alex works to protect disability community from harm
    Then this protective advocacy should be recognized as care work
    And the community_elohim should track Alex's watchdog activities
    And preventing harm is as valuable as providing support
    And Alex's work defending community rights should accumulate tokens
    And the protocol should value both defensive and generative care work
    And Alex's advocacy prevents suffering at scale
    And community protection should be appropriately compensated

  Scenario: Building cross-disability solidarity across different disability communities
    Given disability community includes diverse disabilities and experiences
    And Alex works to build solidarity across different disability groups
    When Alex bridges different disability communities
    Then coalition-building should be recognized as sophisticated care work
    And the community_elohim should value solidarity-building labor
    And connecting different disability experiences strengthens whole community
    And Alex's bridge-building accumulates care tokens
    And the protocol should recognize that unity requires intentional work
    And cross-community organizing should be appropriately valued
    And Alex's solidarity work strengthens collective power for justice
